results.title: The Three A's
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Great Britain. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: One of the principles introduced into education in Great Britain as a result of the New Education Act of 1944 is that of stressing the three A’s rather than the traditional three R’s; the three A’s are - age, ability, and aptitude, of each individual pupil. By considering these three A’s, teachers and parents are better able to provide for each child the type of education most suited to their needs. The aim of education becomes the co-ordination of classroom and practical experience, so that children learn to apply their knowledge and skills to the demands of everyday life.

results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: James Archibald, James Archibald and Associates and John Chittock
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thomson River Dam
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service Productions and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: The dam that was built on the Thomson River in the Great Dividing Range almost doubled the capacity of Melbourne’s water storage as well as aiding in flood control. This is a record of its progress, including the environmental study and the relationship of the dam to downstream users. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: The Thompsons: migrating to the city
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Meg Stewart and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our multicultural society”.
A biographical account of a family who have moved from a small country town to Sydney for the benefit of their children. Discusses some of the problems and differences they encounter. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Thomas leg splint
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “First Aid for Fractures”
Demonstrates step by step how to apply a Thomas leg splint (half-ring) to immobilise any fractures of the thigh, knee or leg.

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair (Original)
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Mirisch Corporation, Simkoel, Solar and Norman Jewison
results.brief_description: Picture the scenario of 5 men who have never met before entering and robbing a bank. Who is the mastermind behind this daring plan? Did he do it for the 2 million dollars or just for the thrill of the heist and the adrenaline rush of not getting caught. Thomas Crown (Steve McQueen) is a Boston tycoon with money to burn and so bored with everyday life that he plans a bank robbery. Does he get away with it or will he get caught by insurance investigator Vickey Anderson (Faye Dunaway)? A glossy cat and mouse caper directed by Norman Jewison whose use of the split screen image leaps from the boardroom to the boudoir, the polo field to a glider cockpit. The Oscar winning song “Windmills of your mind” sets the perfect tone for the swirls of romance and intrigue. The famed chess game seduction scene is a must see. Co-starring Paul Burke and Jack Weston.

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irish Dreamtime, Pierce Brosnan, Beau St Clair and John McTiernan
results.brief_description: This remake of the Steve McQueen movie of the same name stars Pierce Brosnan as thrill-seeking billionaire Thomas Crown. Bored with his life, he decides to stage a daring robbery and steal a priceless painting in broad daylight from one of the most secure museums in the world. Rene Russo stars as his nemesis - insurance investigator Catherine Manning, a woman who is every bit as intelligent, cunning and hungry for adventure as he is - and she will need to be is she is to outwit this master thief. Certain clues point to Crown, so Danning introduces herself into Crown’s social circle. Police detective Michael McCann (Denis Leary) warns Danning that Crown can easily draw people in with his effortless charm, and getting to close him will not be good for her investigation. She is amused by McCann’s suggestion — until she finds herself falling for Crown.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.creator_credit: Centropolis Entertainment, Ute Emmerich, Roland Emmerich, Marco Weber and Josef Rusnak
results.brief_description: Hannon Fuller is a scientist intrigued by time-travel who designs a virtual reality program that allows the player to assume an identity in another era and experience first hand the milieu of the times. Unbeknownst to his co-worker Douglas Hall, Fuller has been using the software, downloading himself into Los Angeles 1937 - the setting of his childhood. When Fuller is brutally knifed to death one night, Hall is suspected of murder. Hall decides to travel back to 1937 to recover a message that Fuller has left for him in the system and hopefully identify the real killer. As the principal characters travel through time, they struggle to maintain their 1930s identities and face the danger of ruining their creation by exposing the game. “The Thirteenth floor” is a science fiction thriller that mimics the technical babble and mind-bending logic of “The Matrix” and “eXistenZ”, without ever really managing to achieve the accomplishments of those finer examples of the genre. The film, stylish in its recreation of the 1930s era and the computer saturated sleekness of the 90s, melds noirish aesthetics, romance, murder mystery and sci-fi adventuring.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.
